events.originalText: War in Afghanistan: In an airstrike in Nangarhar Province, the U.S. military dropped the most powerful conventional bomb ever used in combat.
events.subtitle: War in Afghanistan (2001–2021)
events.headline: U.S. military drops most powerful bomb in Nangarhar Province

events.originalText: Twenty-three people died in a fire at a homeless hostel (aftermath pictured) in Kamień Pomorski; it was Poland's deadliest fire since 1980.
events.subtitle: Kamień Pomorski homeless hostel fire
events.headline: Poland's deadliest fire since 1980 kills 23 in Kamień Pomorski

events.originalText: In golf, 21-year-old Tiger Woods became the youngest player to win the Masters Tournament, breaking its record for the lowest four-round score.
events.subtitle: Tiger Woods
events.headline: Tiger Woods becomes youngest player to win Masters Tournament

events.originalText: Forty people died in an explosion at an ammunition factory in Lapua, Finland.
events.subtitle: Lapua Cartridge Factory explosion
events.headline: 40 dead in explosion at ammunition factory in Lapua, Finland

events.originalText: Catch a Fire, the landmark reggae album by Bob Marley and the Wailers, was released.
events.subtitle: Catch a Fire
events.headline: Bob Marley and the Wailers release landmark reggae album Catch a Fire

events.originalText: In the midst of the Cold War, American pianist Van Cliburn won the inaugural International Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow.
events.subtitle: Cold War
events.headline: American pianist Van Cliburn wins International Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow

events.originalText: The Vietnamese National Army captured Ba Cụt, a military commander of the religious sect Hòa Hảo, which ran a de facto state in South Vietnam in opposition to Prime Minister Ngô Đình Diệm.
events.subtitle: Vietnamese National Army
events.headline: Vietnamese National Army captures Ba Cụt, military commander of Hòa Hảo sect

events.originalText: Ian Fleming's novel Casino Royale was published as the first work to feature his British spy character James Bond.
events.subtitle: Ian Fleming
events.headline: Ian Fleming's novel Casino Royale published, introduces James Bond

events.originalText: Nakam, a Jewish organization seeking revenge for the Holocaust, attempted to poison thousands of SS prisoners at Langwasser internment camp, but did not kill anyone.
events.subtitle: Nakam
events.headline: Jewish organization Nakam attempts to poison SS prisoners at Langwasser internment camp

events.originalText: The Neoclassical Jefferson Memorial (pictured) in Washington, D.C., was formally dedicated on the 200th anniversary of Thomas Jefferson's birth.
events.subtitle: Neoclassical architecture
events.headline: Jefferson Memorial formally dedicated in Washington, D.C. on 200th anniversary of Thomas Jefferson's birth

events.originalText: Austrian soldier Anton Schmid was executed for rescuing Jews from the Ponary massacre in Vilnius.
events.subtitle: Anton Schmid
events.headline: Austrian soldier Anton Schmid executed for rescuing Jews from Ponary massacre

events.originalText: During a closed session of the Diet of Hungary, Lajos Kossuth presented the Hungarian Declaration of Independence from the Habsburg monarchy.
events.subtitle: Diet of Hungary
events.headline: Lajos Kossuth presents Hungarian Declaration of Independence from Habsburg monarchy

events.originalText: The Roman Catholic Relief Act received royal assent, removing the most substantial restrictions on Catholics in the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Roman Catholic Relief Act 1829
events.headline: Roman Catholic Relief Act receives royal assent in the United Kingdom

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British and Hessian forces conducted a surprise attack against a Continental Army outpost at Bound Brook, New Jersey.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British and Hessian forces conduct surprise attack at Bound Brook, New Jersey

events.originalText: The first performance of Messiah, an oratorio by the British composer Handel, was held in Dublin.
events.subtitle: Messiah (Handel)
events.headline: First performance of Handel's Messiah held in Dublin
